title: "What are the key elements of successful magnetic fascination, according to Donato?"
first_phrase: In this final part of the text, the author discusses the qualities of a good subject for magnetism, the dangers of using imperfect subjects in public demonstrations, and the belief in double vision. The author mentions Mr. Donato, an expert in magnetism who uses his methods and procedures to produce extraordinary results. The author describes the state of subjects when they are under the influence of magnetism, neither awake nor asleep, but in an engrossed state where they are obedient to the operator's suggestions. The author also mentions the potential dangers of frequently repeating fascination on one individual.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the debate around the existence and nature of animal magnetism continues, the experiences and observations of those who practice it cannot be easily dismissed. As with any unexplained phenomenon in science, further research and observation is needed to fully understand it. But for those who have witnessed the effects of animal magnetism, it is clear that there is something there worth exploring and studying further.
